panama.util
Class Configuration

java.lang.Object
  panama.util.Configuration

public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object

Provides access to configuration values in an optional panama.properties configuration file. In order to use a different configuration file, you can set a system-property providing a different file name. The system-property must either be named <context>.panama.configuration to only apply to a single web-application in given context or simply panama.configuration in which case it will be used by all panama web applications. Important: This class provides properties only after it's init() method has been invoked. This is done by Panama automatically during startup. If you use this class in a different way (e.g. Unit Tests), make sure you invoke init(String), before trying to retrieve any configuration settings.

Author:
robert.brandner

Method Detail

init

public static void init(java.lang.String appName)
This is invoked by the Dispatcher during initialization at start up. You will normally not use this method, Configuration is all set up after initial start up.

Parameters:
appName -

key -
Returns:

getAll

public static java.util.Properties getAll()
Returns complete configuration

Returns:
Properties object containing all configuration

readProperties

public static java.util.Properties readProperties(java.lang.String... fileNameOptions)
For internal use only. Use getAll() to retrieve all current configuration. Tries to read properties from given fileNameOptions in given order from filesystem and as resource. As soon as properties could be read for a filename, those are returned. If there are no properties for any of the fileNameOptions, null is returned.

Parameters:
classLoader -
fileNameOptions - a list of filenames to be tried in given order
Returns:
Properties (will be empty if none of the filenames could be read)
